alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 2:06PM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MONDAY TO 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches in the lower elevations; 5 to 8 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range, Natrona County Lower Elevations and Casper Mountain. * WHEN...From 5 AM Monday to 5 AM MST Tuesday. The steadiest snow is expected Monday afternoon into Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, including along Interstate 25 and around the city of Casper. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 20 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations
